figure.head: Figure 1:
figure.figDesc:
CMB spectrums for Ω F = Ω B = 0.2, x F = x B = 63109,
τ = 0.13. All the parameters are the same for both curves. The con-
tinuous line corresponds to bosons and the dashed line to fermions.

figure.head: Figure 2:
figure.figDesc:
CMB spectrum for a Universe with Ω B = 0.2, Ω CDM =
0.02, α 10 −26 .

figure.head: Figure 3:
figure.figDesc:
Response of the CMB spectrum to the change in the mass-
to-temperature ratio of the SFDM. For the three curves Ω B = 0.2,
Ω CDM = 0.02, α ∝ 10 −27 .

figure.head: Figure 4:
figure.figDesc:
CMB spectrums for α in the interval (10 −26 , 10 −30 ). With
Ω B = 0.2, Ω CDM = 0.02, and no reionization.

figure.head: Figure 5:
figure.figDesc:
CMB power spectrums for diferent contents of ULBDM
and CDM. For the three curves shown α ∝ 10 −27 , no reionization.

figure.head: Figure 6:
figure.figDesc:
CMB power spectrums for diferent optical depths of reion-
ization. The range shown is from τ = 0.05 to τ = 0.19. Ω Bos = 0.2,
Ω CDM = 0.02, α ∝ 10 −27 .
